ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class SpellingHighlighter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.ErrorHighlighter
      • ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.SpellingHighlighter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.Highlighter

    public class SpellingHighlighter
extends ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.ErrorHighlighter
    A highlighter for source code editors that highlights spelling errors using a SpellingChecker.
    Since:
    3.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpellingHighlighter()

      • SpellingHighlighter

        public SpellingHighlighter()
        Creates a spelling highlighter that uses the shared spelling checker.

      • SpellingHighlighter

        public SpellingHighlighter(EnumSet<ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.TokenType> tokenTypesToCheck)
        Creates a spelling highlighter that uses the shared spelling checker. Only text marked with the token types included in the specified enum set are checked.
        Parameters:
        tokenTypesToCheck - the set of token types to check

      • SpellingHighlighter

        public SpellingHighlighter(SpellingChecker checker,
                           EnumSet<ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.TokenType> tokenTypesToCheck)
        Creates a spelling highlighter that uses the specified spelling checker. Only text marked with the token types included in the specified enum set are checked.
        Parameters:
        checker - the spelling checker to use
        tokenTypesToCheck - the set of token types to check

      • ignoreWord

        protected boolean ignoreWord(Segment text,
                             int offset,
                             int length)
        Called before marking a word as incorrectly spelled. This allows the highlighter to be more lax about spelling errors than a typical spelling-checked component would be. The default implementation ignores words that use CamelCase or that are connected to other words by any of .:/\.
        Parameters:
        text - a segment containing the contents of the current token
        offset - the offset to the start of the match
        length - the length of the match

      • paint

        public void paint(Graphics2D g,
                  ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.HighlightedLine hl)
